website_summaries.verdict: The best set of DSLR camera lens cases with a variety of available sizes for different lens types.
pros: Lens cases come in several individual sizes or as a four pack
Designed to fit all popular lens brands and large sizes such as telephoto lenses
Shuts tight for a secure grip
cons: Some dimensions are not accurate on the product page and may be too large or small for certain lens brands

customer_reviews.title: A Good Product Ruined by lack of QC
customer_reviews.text: They sizes of the pouches have changed, and are not what is claimed at the amazon page. When I contacted the company about this, they said their supplier had made the pouches wider. They are also not as deep. Now my lenses do not fit properly, and move about far too much for adequate protection. This is at best a poor excuse, and shows little in the way of quality control. Why did they accept the products from the outsourcer, if they did not meet their specs. Too bad they ruined a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Merlin Emrys

customer_reviews.title: Great lens cases
customer_reviews.text: Great lens cases! The smallest fits my 50mm, the next was great for the 18-135, next size fits the 55-250 with a little room to spare. The largest would probably fit the camera (canon T5i) without the lens. Nice quality with duffle closure that stays secure. Offers nice protection for those expensive lenses!!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Well built & great protection
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised! I bought this originally for protecting my lenses but it also helped me carry & clip my lenses outside my bag for quick lens replacement and storage. Each fit accordingly to any lens you have. I place both my 24mm & 40mm lenses in the small case, 18-55mm in the mid size case, and my 70-200mm lens in the large case. Well insulated, store your lenses safe from harm in your bag or by clipping just outside your gear bag. It has a belt lope so if you want to place it on your belt or on your shoulder strap, its good to go. Love these pouch kits!
customer_reviews.author: CloArcega

customer_reviews.title: Works, but I still prefer a hard case - just in case ;)
customer_reviews.text: Thick, sturdy. Seem to hold up well to travel so far, but I do prefer a hard case. Either way, I put my lens in these bags before I secondly pack them into a padded camera bag. The four various sizes should accommodate a wide variety of lenses. The drawstring at the top kinda falls short of covering the lens fully, but I have lens caps on the front and the back of my lenses. Overall, pretty good purchase for the price and I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: SAW

customer_reviews.title: Narrow for most lenses, leave the shade on the outside of the bag.
customer_reviews.text: These bags are good quality. I’m not finding them that useful for everyday lens carry. I prefer the wraps. It’s realy hard to get them in and out of the bag. It might be that my lenses are just bigger than these are made for. For example, I have a 35mm 1.4 lens. If I put it with the lens cap turned backwards, I can barely fit it into the medium bag. My other prime lenses require me to keep the lenshade on the outside. I will only use these when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazn Artist

customer_reviews.title: Good quality protection for your lenses
customer_reviews.text: I use a Fujifilm X series kit. When I travel, I usually take my 56mm and 16mm primes. On these occasion, I would pack the medium sized pouch, and while I'm out and about shooting, I would keep one lens in the pouch and attach the pouch to the bottom of my backpack strap with its clip. This way, it actually provides a pretty quick access to the lens for me while providing good protection. The padding is thick, and the inner lining is soft. The pouches are just good quality, and if you need anything to protect your lenses while storing them or on the go, these will do a pretty good job.
customer_reviews.author: gk1185

customer_reviews.title: Not the Best Quality or Size
customer_reviews.text: I don’t care much for these. Not the best quality, feel, or size assortments, but they cover the lenses against dust and scratches. I don’t think they would protect against any sorts of impact though. The textured neoprenes are at least nicer to touch, but this is plane. The smallest size could not even fit Sony FE 50mm 1.8, so I don’t know what’s its purpose. The next big one is too large for it. I think they need to rethink all the sizes. I needed something quick and didn’t have time to research more, otherwise I would’ve returned them. Thanks for reading.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Well made and seems like good quality but careful about sizing before you buy
customer_reviews.text: i ordered these to help protect my lenses when traveling. i have a lot of gear and not always able to use camera bags so i was looking for cases/pouches that would help. the quality is def good. looks like it's well made but the sizing is super tight. def can't fit any Canon L lenses w/ lens hoods. i wasn't able to fit my 70-200L w/ the tripod mount. it seems pointless if i have to keep removing lens hoods and mounts. not really sure what to use them for and it's more effort for me to return them. maybe it'll hold a water bottle/beer! haha.
customer_reviews.author: JFD

customer_reviews.title: Good Protection at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I normally keep my lenses in my camera bag. Recently was heading out on a business trip and didn't want to take my entire bag along with my laptop bag and suitcase. I wanted to find a way to protect an extra lens so that I felt comfortable keeping it in my laptop bag. These really fit the bill. There are four that provide nice padded protection. They use a drawstring to close so while they are neoprene and provide some protection from spills, there is still a chance to have a fluid get inside. Overall, they do what I wanted them to.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J Jacek

customer_reviews.title: Nice, well made lens case
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the three and am only using the smallest one at this time. My Nikon 50mm FX lens fits perfectly. The mid-size is also useful and still looking for something to put in the large one. It's pretty big, but not big enough for D750 body. Light weight, well made and has nice fuzzy interior. Provides adequate protection for putting lens in pack for travel. Also use Lowepro lens cases, but they are hard to find these days. Would recommend Altura cases if you are looking for on the go storage.
customer_reviews.author: kdu-917

customer_reviews.title: These are well-made.
customer_reviews.text: These feel solidly made, and I will be happy to trust my lenses in these cases. They have no rigidity, so they don't stand up like the photo implies. Also the drawstring doesn't cinch as neatly as the photograph implies. However, they feel well-made, and I expect I'll be able to trust the materials and stitching to keep everything safe. They are also well-padded, and the plastic clips feel like they're constructed of high-quality plastics.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan WoodTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE-Quality
customer_reviews.text: After reading all of the positive reviews I was very disappointed to see how quickly one of the pouches came apart at the seam. This happened after using the pouch for less than two weeks for my 10-18mm Canon lens. I did not overuse the pouch or cause any undue stretching when removing the lens. Unfortunately, Amazon says I have let too much time pass before returning this badly constructed item, so I will need to replace it with something better. Buyer beware! UPDATE: Immediately after seeing my post, the company reached out and offered to replace the entire set! The set arrived promptly and so far the product is holding up perfectly. Excellent customer service!!
customer_reviews.author: Giant

customer_reviews.title: Great protective lens bags...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set of neoprene lens cases to protect a recently-purchased used Nikon 70-300mm lens. The second-largest bag of the set fits the 70-300. Thought it's a squeeze fitting the hood in with the lens, it does work. The cases are well-constructed with good drawstrings and beefy neoprene. The entire set strikes me as an amazing bargain for barely over a dozen dollars. I'm glad I purchased them. I intend to replace my Nikon cases with these neoprene bags on all my lenses. These are for casual protection. They will protect from minor bangs and minor water exposure. They're exactly what I was looking for--protection for everyday life and use, not for extreme conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Nebti13

customer_reviews.title: High quality and snug fit thick lens bags.
customer_reviews.text: High quality and snug fit lens bags. These bags have thicker neoprene and thicker draw cords than the less expensive Amagg neoprene lens bags. Both the Altura and Amagg bags have clips. The Altura bags cost a little more but are easily worth it if you're looking for greater protection, build quality and durability. However, the Amagg bags are lighter and looser, if you want to save every bit of weight you can or have stubby lenses, and they are less expensive. Amagg and Altura are NOT the same product simply rebranded. They are definitely their own brands with their own characteristics. Pick whichever suits your needs better.
customer_reviews.author: 7Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens Protection for Travelers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set because I am constantly traveling and needed something more compact than my current camera bag. I am currently only using 3 out of the 4 that come in the set, as the small one does not fit any of my lenses. However, it can be repurposed to hold chargers and extra batteries if you have them. The inside lining is incredibly soft, with the outside material feeling durable and shock resistant. I would still definitely not be careless when handling my lenses in these pouches, but I now have more confidence in transporting them safely and securely. (Notes: I neglected to test out the water-resistance capability, not something I want to ever have to try out)
customer_reviews.author: Kiva L

customer_reviews.title: Well padded and well built
customer_reviews.text: Really like this product. Fits 3 out of 4 of my lenses, but i knew my biggest wouldnt fit, its a 500/1000mm from opteka. But the pouches are nicely padded and have belt loops and clips to attach to photo gear, like vests or packs i dont know how much i would trust the clips they look to be strong and made well, but if it was to fail i wouldn't be able to replace my lens, so im gonna use the clip and belt loop with a grimlock to hold to my gear. These are very nice and look well made will definitely order more when needed
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Poor choice for lens protection
customer_reviews.text: The lens covers are made of nice protective material. However, as the cases get longer, they also get bigger around. Only the smallest one is actually the correct diameter for the lenses. The larger ones have so much slack and extra material that they do not hold the lenses properly. I can pinch nearly 4 inches of extra material on the largest one, pinch about 3 inches extra material on the second to largest, and about 2 inches extra material on the third one. These cases are definitely not a good choice for lens covers.
customer_reviews.author: Father

customer_reviews.title: Good pouches to protect your lens from damage.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to allow me to carry my lenses in a non-camera backpack. This is good for cases where you don't want to carry a lot of extra bulk of gear you don't want to use and just place your lenses in a small backpack. The inside of these are very soft and will keep your lenses from getting damaged due to the velvety smooth material. Overall, I have been very happy with all goja products. They are priced wonderfully and have good quality. These protective pouches will allow me to safely carry my lenses around. I use the largest pouch to hold some accessories due to me not having such a large lens.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew MTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: May not fit as intended
customer_reviews.text: From an extensive search on Amazon, these were the best I could really find for my lenses. They’re not as thick as I thought they would be. They’re definitely scratch proof and slight hit proof but absolutely not drop proof. If considering be aware that the dimensions given in the listing are the OUTSIDE dimensions, not the inside. Per the specs of my lenses and this listing the cases should have been a little big for my lenses however since the listing size is the outside dimensions my lenses barely fit. The largest fits snugly with my zeiss batis 135mm, middle size one fits my sigma art 35mm and the small one fits my lens adapter well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very well made with quality materials. Inside is line ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well made with quality materials. Inside is lined with a very soft velvet material. However, with that I noticed it sheds fur (pictured). Not much but it's there. They are extra roomy or fat so not a snug fit unless maybe you have thick lens'. I would say it may be too fat for APS-C camera lenses. In my picture is the large size from the 3 pack with a Sony a6300. These have plenty of padding for putting in your bag or backpack. Good $12 investment.
customer_reviews.author: AmmozonTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Nice and protective without being overly thick
customer_reviews.text: Nice and protective without being overly thick. The outside seems good a nice neoprene. The inside is VERY soft micro fiber. There is a nice clip and a handle that could be a belt mount if a bit large for that purpose. It all seems decently stitched and have held up nicely so far. My one complaint is how the sets are sold... Just buying 1 medium is sort of pointless when the set is a much better deal. However I need multiple mediums and wish there was a set of 3-4 medium instead of the variable sizing.
customer_reviews.author: Uhgg

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and well padded
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to carry a couple lenses in a soft side bag, as I am going on a trip where luggage is limited so I cannot take my usual camera bag with me. I found a hard side case for my camera but also needed these for extra lenses. They are EXTREMELY well made, heavy duty and thickly padded. I only needed two for lenses and will be using one of the others in the set for my sunglasses!
customer_reviews.author: TSpencer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised when I opened the package! For the price my expectations were not too high but the quality is good and they look very nice. Will definitely keep my lenses a little safer in the camera case. The photo is the small with a Sony SEL50F18 with hood and lens caps. The medium has a Sony SAL18250 w UV Filter, lens caps and attached Sony LA-EA1 mount adapter. My other lens is a Sony SEL18135 and it’s fits nicely in the medium with a little extra room. The large is WAY too big for any of my lenses above. Wish they sold a pack of 2 mediums and 2 smalls.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: If you want the best then look no further!
customer_reviews.text: I have recently purchased some very expensive lenses (each over $2000) and I was looking for something that would protect them under all circumstances. These items are amazing! They are very thick and you can even feel the protection in your hands when you squeeze them. I lucked out as these were the first lens bags that I have ever purchased. I am an individual who demands the best in everything I buy and these definitely fit the bill. If you want protection for your expensive or even less expensive lenses then look no further ! Additionally, Ultra Photo provided excellent service and speedy delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Reed

customer_reviews.title: High quality, versatile lens pouch that are larger than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: These lens pouches are great. Very cushiony. I’m glad I bought them. They are larger than I expected. My lenses are kind of lost inside them with a lot of room left over. If you have tight constraints when packing to travel. You might be packing a lot of added padding. Maybe I could pack my socks or underwear in with my lenses to conserve space.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S. Szymczak

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the cost
customer_reviews.text: I didn't buy these to use as lens pouches. they are super soft inside and the closure device holds well. the only reason I gave it 4 starts on durability is because I haven't had them long. as for functionality they are pretty much lens pouches. the top does not stretch open much more than the width of the pouch itself. so the top isn't stretchy so putting anything in the bag that is actually larger than the bag is tough to do. that's why I marked it a 3 for versatility... but as a lens pouch they are very nice
customer_reviews.author: Ian S.

customer_reviews.title: Great cases for Canon Rebel T6 camera lenses
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set for my 55mm and 300mm lenses for my Canon Rebel T6 for travel purposes. The 55mm lens does fit into the small pouch, but I would not recommend using it in that pouch since you can't not fully close the top; it is better suited in the medium pouch. Same goes for 300mm lens, it fits in medium bag but does not close all the way at opening, I would suggest using large pouch for that size lens. I plan to use the small pouch for my GoPro Hero3 instead. Overall, I am very satisfied with the product and the seller's quickly shipping. These are quality products and I would purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Marie

customer_reviews.title: Sizes are a little odd, but otherwise worked.
customer_reviews.text: I used this with a Cannon 18-55mm and 55-250mm lenses. The small barely covered the small lense and the medium size was way too big. The medium fit over the 250 lense but was rather loose. The large size was almost large enough to cover the camera body.(so I’d get the xl if you want a little extra protection) Since I had another pack for the small lense the fact that it didn’t cover the top wasnt a huge deal breaker, and I used both the medium and the large on the other lense to buffer it during travel days.
customer_reviews.author: SBonney

customer_reviews.title: I prefer Altura over the competition.
customer_reviews.text: These do a marvelous job keeping multiple lenses cushioned for quiet toting in all kinds of lens/camera bags and to prevent chipping and scratching both in the bags and being swapped around while anticipating the next good shot. There are other brands but I started with these and found I'd stumbled into getting the best of the bunch first.
customer_reviews.author: Todd F

customer_reviews.title: Nice extra layer of protection for lenses.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because the Nikon cases that came with my lenses are too bulky to pack in my Lowe backpack - but needed more protection than the dividers alone provided. These are just right - soft inside, thin, easy to get lenses in and out, but provide protections when travelling without alot of bulk. Attached clips are very handy for keeping a spare lens handy on a belt loop without having to open the whole pack. Using now for Nikon 14mm f2.5, Nikon 50mm f1.4, and Nikon Macro/micro 85mm f3.5 (a little tight). Hoods sit outside the sleeve - not inside as with Nikon cases. Filters fit fine. And I don't wince when my camera bag goes through security.
customer_reviews.author: Gisele

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: These are actual in quality. Nice and thick, durable. There are other very similar lens protectors made by a company called CADeN. DO NOT waste your time and money on them. They are thinner and not as good quality. Definitely get these Altura brand sleeves. I can't tell you how many times I had dropped my lenses from waist height on 2 solid rock or concrete floor and no damage at all. These things are wonderful
customer_reviews.author: ShootRAW

customer_reviews.title: Nice solution to lens storage!
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job in protecting lenses. I only wish the bags were a little smaller in radius. Most of my lenses have a bit of room to wiggle around. However, the nice thing is that it doesn't really matter when they get packed away. The excess part of the bag just becomes extra cushion. I prefer these over camera bags because these allow for more flexibility. I don't need to bring a large camera bag everywhere. These allow me to take what I need in a smaller bag.
customer_reviews.author: Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good quality; appropriate padding; good for travel
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for travel to protect camera lenses and body -- instead of the BIG, heavy padded camera bag. The items arrived as promised. The padding is adequate; the construction is good; they are lighter weight to reduce weight in luggage. I will use them for international travel. Space and weight in carry-on and checked baggage is limited. These should hold up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Swan

customer_reviews.title: Well made; great price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for several months. They are well constructed and look like they'll hold up well. When hiking and photographing, I find regular messenger bags and hiking backpacks better constructed and more comfortable than the dedicated camera gear back packs i've tried. So i simply keep my lenses in these pouches in the pack, to give them some protection from all the other items. These pouches work great for this.
customer_reviews.author: Craig C in DC

customer_reviews.title: Great quality...not disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I found these pouches to be very useful. First, the quality is excellent. The exterior casing appears to be of high-quality. The interior is soft and non-abrasive and will ensure your lenses remain unscratched. The exterior clip is a nice touch for those who wish to attach the pouch to their belt or bag. I personally put the pouches back in my backpack. These pouches provide great protection to your lenses or other equipment you store in them. I was pleasantly surprised when opening up my package to find these of higher quality than I anticipated. A great buy and addition to anyone's camera equipment.
customer_reviews.author: TF-Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Thick Protective Lens Case
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a pouch to carry a set of lens hoods. These pouches work perfectly. The set comes with 4 sizes. The material is very thick, closes tightly and has a hook on the side for attaching to another bag. The bag next to the largest was big enough for a 55-300 lens with plenty of room (pictured). I was able to fit 4 hoods in one of the smaller bags. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: ThoseBesideUsTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good value and enough padding
customer_reviews.text: These pouches are pretty good for the money. Almost better than some with zips and belt loops that sell each for the same price as this set. I actually used one to add more padding for a zoom telephoto in a zipped pouch that is a bit too large on diameter. Makes the lens fit snug and adds a bit more protection
customer_reviews.author: ARD

customer_reviews.title: Great for Lenses and Accessories
customer_reviews.text: I prefer a modular approach to my camera bag, having separate cases for each piece of gear so I can grab what I want for a particular shoot and put it in any kind of bag, rather than having a dedicated bag for all my gear and lugging around unnecessary items. So, this is exactly what I was looking for. The ones I didn't have lenses for (telephoto) I use to carry accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Legally Homeless

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Protection for All Your Lenses.
customer_reviews.text: These are Great Padded Protective Covers for my Canon DSLR Lenses. They fit all my lenses perfectly. I have an EF-S 18-55mm IS STM Lens + EF-S 55-250mm IS STM Lens + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 IS USM Telephoto Zoom Len. I am now confident that my lenses are safe from jolting, doping, or impacts while they are stored and transported in my Camera & Accessories bag. I highly recommend these Lens Bags.
customer_reviews.author: KingCallahan

customer_reviews.title: TOO SMALL for me, but good for smaller lenses
customer_reviews.text: First the positive, these are exceptionally made quality wise - beautiful. However, I have no idea how they think the pictured lenses will actually fit in them - now way, even with the lens hood completely removed. Very very disappointing. I bought these specifically for the lenses they have pictured. I have to return them...darn
customer_reviews.author: Jedwabne

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Test out the sizes for your lenses though.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for lenses. Bought the four pack. The small holds my Canon 50mm 1.4 perfectly, the medium holds my Canon EF-S 10-22 nicely, the large is big enough for either my Canon 24-70 2.8 or my Canon EF 70-300 4-5.6. the last two lenses are not snug in the large but too big for the medium, though well padded in the large but with some space on sides and top. The drawstring helps cinch it down a bit. The lens hood for the 24-70 does not fit in the large and also does not fit in the extra large.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: what an great product. Much better than I was expecting and ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what an great product. Much better than I was expecting and absolutely amazing for the price. Very thick and well made. The nice cam lock and belt clip are great pluses. The second I took them out of the package I could tell by how they felt that they were a high quality product. The small one holds my 18-55mm lens, the medium fits my 55-200mm telephoto lens with room to spare and the large one has been confiscated by my roommate for his 3dsxl. Just super pleased with this product and very highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Rerick

customer_reviews.title: Very loose fitting pouches
customer_reviews.text: Fits very loosely on my lenses. The smallest pouch is almost useless bc it’s too small to fit my smallest lense. Therefore, I used it for my GoPro. The material of the product is very nice and durable. I just wish the company would edit the sizing of the pouches. I give the company 5 stars bc they contacted me regarding my dissatisfaction with their product. Overall the company has excellent customer service and really made an effort to fix any issues with their products.
customer_reviews.author: Cin

customer_reviews.title: Great Bags
customer_reviews.text: The bags are made of very nice material with lots of padding. Most lenses will fit the smallest 2 bags so it would be better to have an option with more of the small ones than having the 2 really big ones. A typical 70-200 will fit the 3rd largest so it may be tricky to find something to fit in the largest bag. Would buy again if the seller creates a another version that has all small and medium bags only.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. I use with all lenses for traveling in my motorcycle. Cinch straps work well. Good quality. Because of the different sizes, sometimes I install the lens hood then the pouch (this probably protects the glass better anyway). Recommended product.
customer_reviews.author: Markluke

customer_reviews.title: Nice Storage Cases
customer_reviews.text: Well made and appear to be quality items. I purchased these to store camera lenses and equipment. The only downside is that they are a little large for most camera cases. I am able to use some of them but due to the size some will have to be utilized in some other capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Carson

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: These are a bit bulky, but I guess that's the point, added protection. They are incredibly soft on the inside. I think they're pretty awesome for the price. I can't see giving the competitor twice the price for a skimpy cloth bag that doesn't have the padding these do. They also have clips which can come in handy for storage; I don't think I'd trust them hanging on my bag out on a shoot though.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. I have four lenses and a shotgun mic for my Canon 6D. I used the tallest bag for the shotgun mic, the next bag for my 100-300mm lens, the next one for 100mm macro lens, and the smallest bag for my 40mm lens. I leave my 24-105mm lens on my camera. Now I don’t have to worry about throwing my lenses in a regular backpack. Would definitely recommend these bags for anyone with multiple lenses who doesn’t always carry their lenses in a camera backpack.
customer_reviews.author: L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Product photo doesn't match the actual item
customer_reviews.text: Product doesn't match the photos. The actual bags I received are way too large and wide, and the product photo isn't accurate. I could use the largest bag I received comfortable as an oven mitt or a mitten. The smaller two bags are useful for lenses. On the positive side these seem to be high-quality bags and will protect your lenses quite well. I'll find uses for the larger ones. Two stars given for the deceptive photo and product description.
customer_reviews.author: txcoder

customer_reviews.title: Lens covers for travel
customer_reviews.text: These are fairly lightweight and hold lenses or other small photo equipment or other items for travel. My only complaint is that the drawstring is hard to pull all the way closed because the fabric is very thick and strong. It wasn't a problem because halfway closed was plenty for the lenses. They are also very reasonably priced
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday bag for lens
customer_reviews.text: Great bags for extra lens storage or other camera supplies. Very strong material and soft on the inside. Only complaint is that they do not close completely because the draw string is stiff. They are great for everyday use however, I’m not sure if I would travel with them due to fear of water getting in through the top.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Sheffieck

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of inexpensive lens pouches
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for general protection of my various lenses but most importantly for a 70-200mm f2.8. Nice pouches that protect lenses from scratches and bumps and jolts of carry in un-cushioned bag but not water proof or dust proof. Largest pouch not able to hold the 70-200 though so I will have to keep searching.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal. I Hope They Last
customer_reviews.text: These same bags show up under several different company names. The ONE that I needed for my new telephoto was $8.00 and this entire pack was $12.99....a "well duh" kind of thing to me. They protect well, will be interesting to see how long they last. A secondary benefit. I only need two of them. The other two I am using to store other camera stuff. With these I feel comfortable just tossing things in my daypack, vs. buying a specific camera bag, which I don't really want.
customer_reviews.author: Xoss

customer_reviews.title: Love these but kind of wishing I had just ordered ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these but kind of wishing I had just ordered individual pieces - but ended up getting the set since it was more economical. Right now I really only need the small which fits 2 of my small lenses (50mm and 24mm) together and the medium which fits my 18-135. The other two are pretty big but I might end up using the largest one for my go-pro gimbal. I'm sure I'll find some sort of use for them even if just stuffing them with cords and memory cards.
customer_reviews.author: DesignerMama

customer_reviews.title: Good product but with limitations
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad for 10 bucks, but i found the dimensions very limiting. Most of my wide angle lenses such as 10-24 fuji and the 16-55 fuji do not fit in these bags. But my micro 4 /3 stuff fits great along with a speed light in the biggest bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Quality lens pouch.
customer_reviews.text: Very well padded lens protector. I have had this product for about 6 months now, and the seams are still holding strong, and there is no fraying or splitting. The neoprene is about 1/8" thick and has done a good job minimizing the wear and tear on my lenses. The interior fabric has also held up very well and I have not found this lens pouch to shed or leave fibers on my lenses. Finally, the drawstring does not slip or loosen once locked into place, virtually eliminating the possibility for a lens to fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Yu

customer_reviews.title: They're great, they provide plenty of protection to the lenses
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to be able to carry a lens or two with me at times when I don't want to carry a camera bag with me. They're great, they provide plenty of protection to the lenses, they're soft inside, and being able to clip onto a belt loop is convenient. The biggest lens I own is a Canon EF 70-300mm f/4-5.6 IS USM, which easily fits in the second largest pouch, so I would have been fine with the 3 pack instead of the 4 pack.
customer_reviews.author: J. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em!
customer_reviews.text: They are thick and soft, I absolutely love them! I'll actually need to order a couple of the smaller/medium sizes since I have multiple smaller lenses. But so far, they have been pretty good for storing and protecting my lenses. And they're purple and balck! They match my camera bag!
customer_reviews.author: Elisa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have a few itms from Altura and all have been exceptional. The only thing with these is they are alittle wider than expected, not really a bad thing tho. makes it really easy to get lense s in and out. Very well made, Great quality, plenty of padding to protect your gear. The 3 sizes seem to be perfect for everything from a 300mm zoom to a 50mm prime.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Lens Protection
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for storing my extra lenses that wont fit into my photo backpack. These are very nice and made with good quality. I have purchase several products from Altura and have been satisfied. The only reason I gave a four is because of the versatility, I only use the medium and large pouch as the x large is way to big for any lens I own and the small doesnt hold anything I have. So I wish they would sell these individually and I would buy many more small and mediums to cover all my lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Pic

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice.
customer_reviews.text: I would buy more of these. I only wish they were a tiny bit larger (which is why not 5) as they are a little snug, had a hard time getting my lenses with their hoods into the bags - did get them all in, but was a bit difficult. If you have no lens hoods or take them off, lenses should fit in fine. I put these on my lenses inside of my travel bag to give the lenses a little bit more protection while traveling on a plane. Update - I have found they loosen up a bit (from the stretching of putting the lens in & out so move them up to a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: The Grouchy Librarian

customer_reviews.title: Nice pouch, but two of them are too wide for snug fit of lenses
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these pouches. I have a Canon 75-300mm, Canon 18-135mm , and a Canon 10-18mm. I listed them in that order to reflect the order of the pouches as they appear on the add photo. The 10-18mm is the only lens that has a good fit. The other two are the right height but the internal width has too much free space on the sides and the lens moves around in the pouch. 1 out of 3 of these pouches is being used for a lens and two of them are sitting in a drawer awaiting a proper use. For that reason, the set lost a star for each I cannot use.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great product, Outstanding service
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this set to accommodate a telephoto lens I have. I am impressed that the Pouch Set arrived several days early! The pouches are sized correctly to fit lens' with enough room to allow easy access and lens removal. The material and construction is sturdy. I only gave the water resistance a four star rating because I haven't tested that feature. However, judging from the other qualities of the product I am confident that they will perform well.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Moon

customer_reviews.title: My favorite camera item to date. Besides my cameras.
customer_reviews.text: This was my second purchase of this set. First was for my Canon lenses, then I bought a Nikon and ordered a second set for the NIKKOR lenses. They have all been through the "test" and am extremely happy with them, and am hoping they will come out with something for telephoto length lenses. I would recommend these to anyone anxious about protecting their lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence Martin

customer_reviews.title: These stand up to the most expensive lens bags
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these bags. A family member has some that were super expensive and honestly I kind of like these even better. It's really a great value for sturdy, thick bags that keep my lenses safe plus I love the hint of color. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Pagetwin

customer_reviews.title: Kangaroos are jealous of these pouches.
customer_reviews.text: Pouches are excellent. Just buy 'em, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rooney

customer_reviews.title: Protection for lenses
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a camera case/bag for my lenses so this is a great alternative for my lenses. The material quality is great and it's water resistant and keeps my lenses protected from other abrasive items in my bag. Happy purchase! Definitely very helpful for traveling purposes.
customer_reviews.author: adelu

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens Pouches
customer_reviews.text: I bought the (4 Pack) for my Canon lenses. They are just right for my Canon EF 70-300 lens. I believe it will protect my lens for a long time. I won't have to worry about the lens bumping around in my camera bag and getting scratched up or damaged. I would recommend this product to all family and friends, it is a good product to have to protect your expensive lens.
customer_reviews.author: Buzzin Bee ReviewsTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Must have!!
customer_reviews.text: Two and a half years of use and still in use. High quality and resilient. Lots of hauling with these and still in great shape. Which means they have also protected the many lenses that we own. Great investment for your investment.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Reed

customer_reviews.title: I am pretty pleased with these protective cases for my lens
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty pleased with these protective cases for my lens. It is as described. I feel good that these sleeves will protect my lens while I am traveling. As some have stated, the top does not stretch so it is a little tight if you have added the lens hood to your lens and try to add it into the case. If you are a little patient, it can be done as long as your hood is not to wide. But overall, I do enjoy it. It is much better than the standard lens cover that came with my lens as it is well padded. I used the M size for my Nikon 18mm-200mm lens with its hood.
customer_reviews.author: S A M

customer_reviews.title: YOU NEED TO READ THIS
customer_reviews.text: At first I was going to use these in place of an actual expensive camera bag but one day while shooting I realized what makes them so amazing. So when I took out my camera of the large bag (I have a Nikon D5600 and it is a bit of a squeeze), I was wondering what the clips on the side are used for and then it clicked. You can use them on the side of your bag so that you can make quick lens changes on the go! Literally the most useful thing I have purchased for my camera! BUY THIS. (P.S. They didn't pay me to say this)
customer_reviews.author: Ben M

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful bags that keep your lenses protected
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful bags that keep your lenses protected. A little on the bulky side, but that's what you want if you want your lenses to be protected. Really easy to use and pretty good quality. I currently hold a 24-70mm zoom in the big bag, A 55mm prime lens in the medium bag and a 28mm prime in the small bag. The 28mm is actually too small for the small bag but I still use it because it should be kept protected. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: MDS

customer_reviews.title: Good bags, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great price for perfectly adequate lens pouches. The lack of one star is because there's not extra padding on the bottom, as I've experienced with pricier bags from other suppliers. They also have a vaguely petrochemical smell to them, but not enough to be bothersome. To me, anyway. All of the neoprene bags will allow lens damage if the bag is dropped, or is struck against something hard while swinging from your waist or whatever. These bags are meant to protect against damage while in a camera bag or in a relatively benign environment. If you're looking for ultimate protection (like against drops), you'll need a different design, not a layer of stitched neoprene.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki DM

customer_reviews.title: Nicely padded great material
customer_reviews.text: Received today and already super excited! I hate carrying a purse and camera bag but didn’t want to just stuff extra lenses in my purse!!! Now I can shove one or two in my purse without worrying about them getting scratched up! Very happy. The material is great water resistant and nicely padded.
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: Strong smell that didn't go away. Returned it.
customer_reviews.text: After arriving and un-packaging noticed a strong smell emanating from them. Thinking this might go away after a few days, I left them in the air for about a week but it still didn't help. I ended up returning them primarily due to this issue. The quality seemed okay, but I wouldn't trust high-end glass in it--would much rather go with one of the semi-rigid, padded cases that are floating around. The small case was also too way too big for a Zeiss 35mm prime lens that I tested and I didn't feel like it provided much more than scuff protection.
customer_reviews.author: G. A. Vance

customer_reviews.title: I am sure they would probably be fine. I just can't get past the horrible smell ...
customer_reviews.text: While they are bulkier than I expected, I am sure they would probably be fine. I just can't get past the horrible smell that they have. It is such a strong chemical smell that it actually gave me a headache. They are on the other side of the room now, and I can still smell them. There is no way that I would ever put these with my things when I travel. I can't imagine that a smell that strong would ever dissipate. Unfortunately I now have to go to the trouble of sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen S.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LENS POUCHES
customer_reviews.text: These pouches are PERFECT for my lenses. I was a little worried they would be too small or a very tight fit, but was very surprised to see they not only fit, but have good wiggle room for easy insertion/removal of the lens. They are nice and padded and gives me security in knowing my expensive camera lenses are safe from any harm or damage. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki O'Meara

customer_reviews.title: Good travel pouches
customer_reviews.text: These pouches are well made. Quality and material is good. This is great for tossing lenses in a bag or backpack. It is not for outdoor use since the pull string leaves an opening for water/dust to get inside.
customer_reviews.author: V. Do

customer_reviews.title: Very affordable lens protection.
customer_reviews.text: Very affordable lens protection. Affordable, functionable, effective lens protection for a fraction of what most similar products cost. After receiving these lens pouches I immediately replace older, less protective lens pouches with these to provide more effective long-term storage for my legacy lenses. I have a lot of older lenses, I find that these are a very cost-effective way to provide increased protection to store them. Not perfect, but, a very good combination of value and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: FantasymanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: impressed! handy for when you want to leave the full camera bag behind.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I was really impressed with the quality of these. In general I store my lenses out in the open to help prevent fungus from growing in them but these have been great for when I want to toss an extra lens in a backpack and leave the rest of my camera bag behind. I feel like they provide very good protection and the stitching and materials feel high quality
customer_reviews.author: Christian Johnson

customer_reviews.title: great for the price, heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Like the other reviews, super thick but great protection. I could put two cameral lenses in the bigger pouches. Took them hiking in the backpack, zero issues. Don't know about water resistant, but with the opening at the top, just turn them upside down.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn E.

customer_reviews.title: tough
customer_reviews.text: I like these because the neoprene is high density and really will protect your lenses, unlike the soft foam in my camera bag inserts. That said, the belt loops are just the distance between two anchor stitches, so not really there for the shortest two and two wide on the biggest two.
customer_reviews.author: tkeithlu

customer_reviews.title: Love the quality
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality, but two things can be improved: 1, if the radius is a little bigger, it will allow one hand to easily put it in the bag. 2, if the smallest one can be a tad bigger, it will be great. I mean, which lens is smaller than the smallest bag in this pack, that allows some wiggle room?
customer_reviews.author: Onyx

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic pouches!
customer_reviews.text: These set of pouches are perfect for transporting my lens. The drawstring and cinch keep them closed perfectly and I LOVE the loop that allows me to carry my lens on my belt. It's definitely better for my back that carrying an entire case just to protect my lens. I'm so glad I found this set.
customer_reviews.author: J. Churchill

customer_reviews.title: Protects your glass
customer_reviews.text: Ordinarily I shy away from sets of anything (other than measuring spoons once), but this purchase has worked out very well. It is a quality product and an excellent value. The pouches protect my lenses at home and when traveling. The small fits a 50mm; medium holds a 15-85 when it's not mounted; large is good for the 28-135 and hood or 100mm macro; extra large contains a 70-300 and hood (all Canon lenses). I am entirely satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John O.

customer_reviews.title: Thicker than I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: Even though the description said these were thick, I didnt realize how thick 7ntil I had them in my hand. I'm very pleased with them, better than expected. I would definitely buy them again
customer_reviews.author: T. L.

customer_reviews.title: They are much better than the ones that come with the Nikon prime ...
customer_reviews.text: These are EXACTLY as advertised. They are very thick, slightly smaller than you would expect, but I found a lens to fit in each one. They are much better than the ones that come with the Nikon prime lenses! On top of that, I like to support Digital Goja, the seller. He makes wonderful YouTube videos about DSLR cameras that have helped me immensely. He seems like a nice guy, and if I lived in his state, I'd go to his stroe!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Pizza

customer_reviews.title: Best protection for your camera lenses
customer_reviews.text: Soft interior, neoprene exterior, drawstring closure with carabiner is only part of why I like this product. Yes, these pouches can hold standard lenses, but they're perfect for my LensBaby lenses, optics and macro filters. I wish there was an option to buy the two smaller sized ones separately. For the price, this is an awesome value.
customer_reviews.author: Candace Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: diameter too large,
customer_reviews.text: They're diameter is huge. The small one doesn't fit my canon10-18 adequately and it awkward for the canon 50mm. the 4" diameter ones were way too wide for my 55-250 and I didn't even bother trying my 18-135 canon. I don't know what lens these will be useful for, certainly not any of the common entry-level canon lenses. Maybe the 18-55 but I don't have that anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Durkin

customer_reviews.title: Nice protection for your lenses
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-priced set of lens cases. They are well-constructed, have a nice lining, and do what they're supposed to do. One item of note: The belt loop gets larger as the case gets larger, which might lead to unwanted movement if you wear them on your belt. They won't seal out water, so don't expect that. Overall, though, a good product.
customer_reviews.author: RamJacCorp

customer_reviews.title: Like many of my friends
customer_reviews.text: Like many of my friends, I keep ALL of my camera gear in ONE BIG BACKPACK where it it is well protected. However, on many occasions, I leave the backpack behind an go after a photo opportunity with the camera and - maybe - 2 or 3 lenses. It is for those occasions you need the fine, thick and sturdy Altura bags to protect your investment. The bags are well made, cushion the equipment very well and the closures are very functional. Considering the value of good quality lenses, they are a REAL: BARGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Skov

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set of cases!
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice lense cases. My only complaint is that the “small” is really too small for anything really. Even my basic Nikon 18/50 is too large for the small. Other than that it’s a wonderful set, and I think my lenses are much more protected than before in their suede satchels.
customer_reviews.author: These reviews are mine

customer_reviews.title: Game changer.
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I can pack my lens easier into my daypack AND, rather than carry two cameras or make a big deal of changing lenses, I just carry one size up on my belt loop and swap my lenses quickly and easily in action. They made a huge difference to me on recent travel and long outdoor shoots.
customer_reviews.author: A.T.

customer_reviews.title: I really like these a lot
customer_reviews.text: I really like these a lot. They are good quality for the price I paid for them. I have put them through a lot already and they are holding up very well. The soft inner lining is so easy on my lenses, no scratches, and they have even kept my lenses clean. Those have been my biggest issues with other lens bags. I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cushioning and sizing!
customer_reviews.text: The carabiners are very sturdy and stay hooked to my bag for easy access to my lenses when I'm hiking. The material is very good in the rain and didn't get my lenses wet. The sizes were perfect to fit all my lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Najeeb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Protection
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my lenses! Soft on the inside with a neoprene exterior. Not too thick so they don't take up much more space than it you didn't use them. For those of you that have read the negative reviews about the furry felt on the inside coming out, ignore them. The felt DOES NOT come off without someone tearing it out! Smh...
customer_reviews.author: CADclark

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I often switch between camera bags depending on the "mission" I'm on. My bigger bag has a lot of padding and dedicated pouches for my lenses...but it is big! I use my messenger shoulder bag a lot carrying only a couple lenses. This is where these lens pouches really pay off. They are great! It's easy to get the lens out and when I'm working I can put a lens back in the pouch and not worry about it till I pack up again. I shoot a lot of music venues and can usually get a "space" for my stuff. Having the lenses in these pouches in or out of the bag works for me! Glad I found them.
customer_reviews.author: Carl L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to measure
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these pouches and I basically wanted the middle size for a lens I have. It fit in the largest pouch. I have a smaller lens that barely fits in the small one. They're nice quality as far as i can tell but the sizes seem small. Be sure to measure the lenses you plan to use them for.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon A. Mayhak

customer_reviews.title: Durability.
customer_reviews.text: My first shipment of these lens pouches came with a minor problem with the thread becoming loose on one of the smaller pouches. This vendor has graciously offered me a replacement set at no cost. I've verified the product quality on this second set and all is fine. Kudos to this vendor! Awesome response.
customer_reviews.author: daiqngo

customer_reviews.title: Great protection for the money!
customer_reviews.text: These were just what I was looking for,well made, priced right and function just like I wanted. I keep my lenses in these while in my camera bag. If we are hiking and I don't want to take my whole camera bag, I just have to carry the one lens and it's well protected. The built in clips make it easy to clip on my waist. I liked them so much, we bought another set to give as a Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Nicholsons

product_meta.title: (4 Pack) Altura Photo Thick Protective Neoprene Pouch Set for DSLR Camera Lens (Canon, Nikon, Pentax, Sony, Olympus, Panasonic) - Includes: Small, Medium, Large and Extra Large Pouches
product_meta.description:
Size:4 Pack

(4 Pack) One of each size- S, M, L, XL Altura Photo Thick Protective Neoprene Lens Pouch

This 4-pack includes all 4 sizes of the Altura Photo Neoprene Lens Pouches. These are the highest quality lens pouches on the market. Altura Photo is the only brand that produces lens pouches with super soft interior lining, 5mm extra thick padded bottom, and water resistant neoprene exterior with clips. Although our competitors try to copy our look, none meet our standards of construction quality and functionality.

Features
- Thick pliable neoprene body protects your lens from moisture, sand, dust, dirt, and accidental impact.
- Soft faux fur lining for a unique style, and protection against scratches.
- Strong drawstring pull tab keeps your lens from shifting out, and makes accessing your gear fast and easy.
- Reinforced belt loop and snap and swivel clip provides a convenient and secure way to transport your gear outside of your case.

Dimensions:
- S: 3.1" x 4" (w x h)
- M: 4" x 5.5" (w x h)
- L: 4" x 8.07" (w x h)
- XL: 4" x 9.4" (w x h)

Compatibility:
S: Lenses up to 3" in length:
e.g. Canon EF 50mm F/1.8 STM, Canon EF 85mm f/1.8
M: Lenses up to 4.5" in length:
e.g. Tamron SP 35mm F/1.8 DI VC, Tamron SP 24-70 F/2.8 VC
L: Lenses up to 7" in length:
e.g. Canon EF 100mm F/2.8 L IS USM, Canon EF 70-300 F/4.5-5.6 L*
XL: Lenses up to 8.5" in length:
e.g. Sigma 50-100 F/1.8, Canon EF 70-200 F/2.8* (*Large reversible lens hoods and tripod collars will not fit inside with lens)
feature_bullets: (4 Pack) Includes: Altura Photo Small, Medium, Large and Extra Large Neoprene Pouch Bags for DSLR Camera Lens
Built to Protect: Thick water resistant neoprene protects against moisture, sand, dust, and accidental bumps or scratches.
Dual attachment points: A belt loop and Snap and swivel clip for convenient and secure transport.
Compatible with lenses from Canon, Nikon, Olympus, Fuji, Pentax, Panasonic, Sony, Leica, Sigma, Tamron, and more.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,415 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
